content.raw: We should probably add `uuid` to the list of boost components that we use in [cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake:323](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ba31e3118743f4993f6a64e72c3a54f34b398e06/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake?at=default#cl-323).
content.html: We should probably add uuid to the list of boost components that we use in cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake:323.

content.raw: Apparently, there is no specific static or shared library for uuid in boost. Adding uuid to [cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake:323](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ba31e3118743f4993f6a64e72c3a54f34b398e06/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake?at=default#cl-323) does not work.
content.html: Apparently, there is no specific static or shared library for uuid in boost. Adding uuid to cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake:323 does not work.

content.raw: You are correct, there are only [certain boost libraries](http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_54_0/more/getting_started/unix-variants.html) that require compilation, and `uuid` is not one of them. Sorry for the noise.
content.html: You are correct, there are only certain boost libraries that require compilation, and uuid is not one of them. Sorry for the noise.

content.raw: Sending a filename in a message will break when gzserver and gzclient run on separate machines. There is an implicit assumption that gzclient has access to the same filesystem as gzserver.
content.html: Sending a filename in a message will break when gzserver and gzclient run on separate machines. There is an implicit assumption that gzclient has access to the same filesystem as gzserver.

content.raw: That's totally true. How about sending the full image data?
content.html: That's totally true. How about sending the full image data?

content.raw: I think the height information is already sent. You could store the height data into a binary file on disk, and compute the sha1 from that. Let's discuss a plan on Monday, we'd have to define our own file format for the height data.
content.html: I think the height information is already sent. You could store the height data into a binary file on disk, and compute the sha1 from that. Let's discuss a plan on Monday, we'd have to define our own file format for the height data.

content.raw:
Fixed in a43ff7d

Now, the heightmap data sent from physics to rendering is used to compute the SHA1. This value is compared with the SHA1 stored in the client to validate the terrain cache files.
content.html:
Fixed in a43ff7d

Now, the heightmap data sent from physics to rendering is used to compute the SHA1. This value is compared with the SHA1 stored in the client to validate the terrain cache files.

content.raw: use const refereces if we're not going to modify the variable. ie. `const boost::filesystem::path &_filename`
content.html: use const refereces if we're not going to modify the variable. ie. const boost::filesystem::path &_filename

content.raw: Using `/tmp/gazebo-paging` might have bad effects on a multi-user system. You could insert the username into the file path like `/tmp/gazebo-<username>/paging`. I suggest `paging` as a subdirectory so that we can move the current rtshader cache into `/tmp/gazebo-<username>` as well.
content.html: Using /tmp/gazebo-paging might have bad effects on a multi-user system. You could insert the username into the file path like /tmp/gazebo-<username>/paging. I suggest paging as a subdirectory so that we can move the current rtshader cache into /tmp/gazebo-<username> as well.

content.raw:
It might be also good because you have the terrain cached from another folk :)
But agreed, it's more general if we keep a cache by user. I like Jose's suggestion. I'll work on that.
content.html: It might be also good because you have the terrain cached from another folk :) But agreed, it's more general if we keep a cache by user. I like Jose's suggestion. I'll work on that.

content.raw: This whole function would be even better if it was in `gazebo/common/CommonIface.hh` Then all of Gazebo could get SHA1 values from a file. There should also be a unit test for this function.
content.html: This whole function would be even better if it was in gazebo/common/CommonIface.hh Then all of Gazebo could get SHA1 values from a file. There should also be a unit test for this function.

content.raw: This is a local variable now

Pull request updated:

* Cache terrain files are now stored in $HOME/.gazebo/paging/<terrain_name>
This avoids conflicts between multiple users.

* Terrain cache working when gzserver and gzclient run on separate machines.
content.html:
Pull request updated:

  • Cache terrain files are now stored in $HOME/.gazebo/paging/<terrain_name> This avoids conflicts between multiple users.

  • Terrain cache working when gzserver and gzclient run on separate machines.

content.raw:
by convention it looks like the functions in this class are not CamelCased, but have lower-cased first character and underscores between words, e.g. `get_sha1`.  

And is this file a suitable place to put this function? Maybe we can have our own Hash class which later on we can add more hash functions to it.
content.html:
by convention it looks like the functions in this class are not CamelCased, but have lower-cased first character and underscores between words, e.g. get_sha1.

And is this file a suitable place to put this function? Maybe we can have our own Hash class which later on we can add more hash functions to it.

content.raw:
How about if I create a new pull request for changing the style of the functions in CommonIface (and all the invocations too) to CamelCase and upper-case first letter?

What if we let get_sha1() in CommonIface until we need to create additional hash functions? If this is the case we can create a new class, as you proposed.
content.html:
How about if I create a new pull request for changing the style of the functions in CommonIface (and all the invocations too) to CamelCase and upper-case first letter?

What if we let get_sha1() in CommonIface until we need to create additional hash functions? If this is the case we can create a new class, as you proposed.

content.raw: I realized thanks to @iche033 that the functions in the xxxIface files follow a different naming style. a44641a fixes the wrong name for GetSHA1()
content.html: I realized thanks to @iche033 that the functions in the xxxIface files follow a different naming style. a44641a fixes the wrong name for GetSHA1()

content.raw: void pointers are usually dangerous. Is is possible to make _buffer a specific type?
content.html: void pointers are usually dangerous. Is is possible to make _buffer a specific type?

content.raw: Sorry about the never-ending changes. I promise this is my last. Take a look at 114b5757de8e. It uses templates for `get_sha1`, which may make the function more flexible.
content.html: Sorry about the never-ending changes. I promise this is my last. Take a look at 114b5757de8e. It uses templates for get_sha1, which may make the function more flexible.

content.raw:
* Updated with a new verstion of get_sha1() based on d6d073a.
* The unit test now checks the SHA1 of a vector, a string, and an empty string.
* Added missing doxigen doc in CommonIface
content.html:
• Updated with a new verstion of get_sha1() based on d6d073a.
  • The unit test now checks the SHA1 of a vector, a string, and an empty string.
  • Added missing doxigen doc in CommonIface

content.raw: We have a conflict on this current state. @caguero I'm not very sure of not breaking things, could you solve it, please?
content.html: We have a conflict on this current state. @caguero I'm not very sure of not breaking things, could you solve it, please?
